newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: ARA bunkers forced up by barge market plays.
newsitem.headline: ARA bunkers forced up by barge market plays.

text.p: ARA fuel oil bunkers prices were driven higher by plays in the barge market in the morning, but settled down from the highs, and business was fair.

Rotterdam 380 cst fuel oil rose to $102/$103 fob as two players bought barges aggressively. The highest traded level was $102 fob. Dealers said traded volume reached about 10,000 tonnes, a healthy volume some attributed to a three-day weekend in the U.K.
"There won't be so many people on the barge market on Monday, so people are a bit worried the prices will be forced even higher," one dealer said.
Hamburg prices followed those in Rotterdam. Prices rose in the afternoon to $105 fob. Supply remained good, leaving prices only $2/$3 above Rotterdam levels .
The Mediterranean's response to price rises in northern Europe was sluggish. French and Italian prices were up around $1 a tonne by the close. Spain was little changed. Business was very slack.
Durban's steady climb continued. Fuel oil 180 cst was up another $1 at $104/$106 fob.
